message.content:
We first need to extract the relevant numbers from the three statements. In our case the figures (all “end” values) are as follows:

──────────────────────────────
Step 1. From the Balance Sheet at 2024‐01‐29:
• Cash on Hand = 4,540,900.90  
• Bank Deposits = 2,866,063.83  
• Interest Receivable = 8,967.44  
• Accounts Receivable = 1,851,327.29  
• Inventory = 450,000.00  

• Total Current Assets = 9,717,259.46  
• Current Liabilities (Accounts Payable + Taxes Payable) = 1,240,000.00 + 253,246.99 = 1,493,246.99

• Total Owner’s Equity = 13,707,199.17

──────────────────────────────
Step 2. From the Cash Flow Statement (operating activities):
• Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –64,099.10  
(This “Operating Cash Flow” figure will be used in two ratios.)

──────────────────────────────
Step 3. From the Income Statement:
• Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) = 2,735,000.00  
(For the Inventory Turnover Ratio we also need average inventory. Since beginning inventory is 0 and ending inventory is 450,000.00, the average inventory = 450,000.00 / 2 = 225,000.00.)

──────────────────────────────
Now let’s calculate each ratio step by step.

1. Operating Cash Flow Ratio  
Formula: Operating Cash Flow / Current Liabilities  
= (–64,099.10) / 1,493,246.99  
≈ –0.04296  
Rounded to two decimals (for consistency with example): –0.04

2. Cash Flow to Debt Ratio  
(This ratio is defined in many cases as Operating Cash Flow / Debt. In our example the “Debt” used was the current liabilities.)  
Thus, it is the same calculation as above:  
= (–64,099.10) / 1,493,246.99  
≈ –0.04

3. Inventory Turnover Ratio  
Formula: COGS / Average Inventory  
= 2,735,000.00 / 225,000.00  
≈ 12.1556  
Rounded to two decimals: 12.16

4. Debt to Equity Ratio  
Formula: Total Debt / Total Owner’s Equity  
(Here, “Debt” is taken as the current liabilities)  
= 1,493,246.99 / 13,707,199.17  
≈ 0.1089  
Rounded to two decimals: 0.11

5. Quick Ratio  
Quick Assets = Cash on Hand + Bank Deposits + Interest Receivable + Accounts Receivable  
= 4,540,900.90 + 2,866,063.83 + 8,967.44 + 1,851,327.29  
= 9,267,259.46  
Then,  
Quick Ratio = Quick Assets / Current Liabilities  
= 9,267,259.46 / 1,493,246.99  
≈ 6.206  
Rounded to two decimals: 6.21

6. Current Ratio  
Formula: Total Current Assets / Current Liabilities  
= 9,717,259.46 / 1,493,246.99  
≈ 6.512  
Rounded to two decimals: 6.51

──────────────────────────────
Thus, our final results are:

{"solution": {'Operating Cash Flow Ratio': '-0.04', 'Cash Flow to Debt Ratio': '-0.04', 'Inventory Turnover Ratio': '12.16', 'Debt to Equity Ratio': '0.11', 'Quick Ratio': '6.21', 'Current Ratio': '6.51'}}
